title: Magnetic materials - comparing iron and aluminum

content.question: Two nails are placed in a strong, external magnetic field. One nail is made of iron and the other is made of aluminum. After a few minutes the nails are removed from the external magnetic field and placed a large distance away from each other. How does the new magnetic field of the iron nail <math alttext="B sub F e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mpadded><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>Fe</mi></msub></mpadded></mpadded></math> compare to the magnetic field of the aluminum nail <math alttext="B sub A l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>Al</mi></msub></mpadded></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, B sub F e equals B sub A l, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Fe</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Al</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="B sub F e is less than B sub A l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Fe</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Al</mtext></msub></mpadded></math>
<math alttext="B sub F e is greater than B sub A l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Fe</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Al</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub F e equals B sub A l, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Fe</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Al</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B sub F e is greater than B sub A l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Fe</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mtext>Al</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
